Generation I.Red: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
Generation I.Yellow: The gem in its forehead glows on its own! It walks with all the grace and elegance of a proud queen.
Generation I.Stadium: It is highly regarded as a pet for its beautiful fur. However, it is extremely temperamental and difficult to keep.

Generation II.Gold: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.
Generation II.Silver: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
Generation II.Crystal: Behind its lithe, elegant appearance lies a barbaric side. It will tear apart its prey on a mere whim.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pok é mon 's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
Generation III.Sapphire: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pok é mon 's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
Generation III.Emerald: A Persian 's six bold whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in its vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
Generation III.FireRed: Has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. It is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.

Generation VI.X: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness.
Generation VI.Y: Its lithe muscles allow it to walk without making a sound. It attacks in an instant.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.

Generation VII.Sun: Its round face and smooth coat—softer than the most high-class velvet—have made this a very popular Pokémon in Alola.
Generation VII.Moon: It looks down on everyone other than itself. Its preferred tactics are sucker punches and blindside attacks.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: In contrast to its lovely face, it's so brutal that it tortures its weakened prey rather than finishing them off.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its round face is a symbol of wealth. Persian that have bigger, plumper faces are considered more beautiful.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: It has the classiest coat. The rippling of its fur in the heat of battle has a beauty all its own.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: It has the classiest coat. The rippling of its fur in the heat of battle has a beauty all its own.

Generation VIII.Sword: The round face of Alolan Persian is considered to be a symbol of prosperity in the Alola region, so these Pokémon are very well cared for.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon is one tough opponent. Not only does it have formidable physical abilities, but it's also not above fighting dirty.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is a very haughty Pokémon. Among fans of Persian, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is a very haughty Pokémon. Among fans of Persian, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

Generation IX.Violet: It has a vicious temperament. Beware if it raises its tail straight up. This is a signal that it is about to pounce and bite.
